values.description:
We have merged a formula for ogre1.9 in homebrew, but it causes some rendering and GUI test failures in gazebo.

* jenkins results [before this change](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/825/testReport/) (83 failures)
* jenkins results [after this change](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/832/testReport/) (66 failures)

There are 17 fewer failures (the rendering tests). It can also be seen in the code that it fixes a `FIXME`.

The [ABI checker is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20ABI%20jobs/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/156/API_ABI_report/).
values.title: Fix rendering tests for osx with ogre1.9

We have merged a formula for ogre1.9 in homebrew, but it causes some rendering and GUI test failures in gazebo.

  • jenkins results before this change (83 failures)
  • jenkins results after this change (66 failures)

There are 17 fewer failures (the rendering tests). It can also be seen in the code that it fixes a FIXME.

The ABI checker is clean.

values.description:
This deprecates the `math::Matrix3` class, which was only used in a few API's in `physics::Inertial` and `physics::Link`; so those API's are deprecated as well and replaced with functions using `ignition::math::Matrix3d`.

It also fixes `UNIT_gz_log_TEST` (#2116).
values.title: Deprecate math::Matrix3 class and fix #2116

summary.raw:
This deprecates the `math::Matrix3` class, which was only used in a few API's in `physics::Inertial` and `physics::Link`; so those API's are deprecated as well and replaced with functions using `ignition::math::Matrix3d`.

It also fixes `UNIT_gz_log_TEST` (#2116).
summary.html:
This deprecates the math::Matrix3 class, which was only used in a few API's in physics::Inertial and physics::Link; so those API's are deprecated as well and replaced with functions using ignition::math::Matrix3d.

It also fixes UNIT_gz_log_TEST (#2116).

values.description:
I was peeking at some of the windows warnings to see if any of them would impact API/ABI, and I noticed a few instances where virtual functions don't have the same signatures (differences in the `const`ness of several arguments, [msbuild warning C4373](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-default-windows7-amd64/437/warnings38Result/category.63475806/)). I've fixed 4 of those warnings here:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/1080/warnings38Result/fixed/

There is still a [warning in Palette.cc](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-default-windows7-amd64/437/warnings38Result/category.63475806/package.1656517967/) that I didn't fix because it involves a qt class, and I was a little confused.
values.title: Match const parameters in virtual functions to fix windows warnings

I was peeking at some of the windows warnings to see if any of them would impact API/ABI, and I noticed a few instances where virtual functions don't have the same signatures (differences in the `const`ness of several arguments, [msbuild warning C4373](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-default-windows7-amd64/437/warnings38Result/category.63475806/)). I've fixed 4 of those warnings here:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/1080/warnings38Result/fixed/

summary.html:
I was peeking at some of the windows warnings to see if any of them would impact API/ABI, and I noticed a few instances where virtual functions don't have the same signatures (differences in the constness of several arguments, msbuild warning C4373). I've fixed 4 of those warnings here:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/1080/warnings38Result/fixed/

There is still a warning in Palette.cc that I didn't fix because it involves a qt class, and I was a little confused.

values.description:
This is related to issue #1311.

The code in GuiIface.cc doesn't work, because gazebo::client::addPlugin() calls gazebo_shared::addPlugin() which only supports system plugins. Same for gazebo_shared::setup(), it only supports system plugins and calls Load(argc,argv) and Init(argc,argv), which the GUIPlugin doesn't have.

The error described in issue #1311 happens because QApplication has to be created before the plugin is loaded (requirement by Qt). But in the current version of GuiIface.cc, the plugin is created too early in parse_args().

This PR fixes this issue. Now gzclient can be started with the -g parameter, e.g.

``gzclient -g <your-plugin-lib>.so``
values.title: Load GUI Plugins with gzclient parameter -g, fixes issue 1311

summary.raw:
This is related to issue #1311.

The code in GuiIface.cc doesn't work, because gazebo::client::addPlugin() calls gazebo_shared::addPlugin() which only supports system plugins. Same for gazebo_shared::setup(), it only supports system plugins and calls Load(argc,argv) and Init(argc,argv), which the GUIPlugin doesn't have.

The error described in issue #1311 happens because QApplication has to be created before the plugin is loaded (requirement by Qt). But in the current version of GuiIface.cc, the plugin is created too early in parse_args().

This PR fixes this issue. Now gzclient can be started with the -g parameter, e.g.

``gzclient -g <your-plugin-lib>.so``
summary.html:
This is related to issue #1311.

The code in GuiIface.cc doesn't work, because gazebo::client::addPlugin() calls gazebo_shared::addPlugin() which only supports system plugins. Same for gazebo_shared::setup(), it only supports system plugins and calls Load(argc,argv) and Init(argc,argv), which the GUIPlugin doesn't have.

The error described in issue #1311 happens because QApplication has to be created before the plugin is loaded (requirement by Qt). But in the current version of GuiIface.cc, the plugin is created too early in parse_args().

This PR fixes this issue. Now gzclient can be started with the -g parameter, e.g.

gzclient -g <your-plugin-lib>.so

values.description:
Fixes issue #553 and issue #1108

# API change summary

Old | New
--- | ---
*Get number of degrees of freedom* |
`virtual unsigned int GetAngleCount() const = 0` | `virtual unsigned int DOF() const = 0`
*Get joint position* |
`math::Angle GetAngle(unsigned int _index) const` | `virtual double Position(const unsigned int _index = 0) const final`
`virtual math::Angle GetAngleImpl(unsigned int _index) const = 0` | `virtual double PositionImpl(const unsigned int _index = 0) const = 0`
*Set upper joint limit* | 
`bool SetHighStop(unsigned int _index, const math::Angle &_angle)` | `virtual void SetUpperLimit(const unsigned int _index, const double _limit)`
`void SetUpperLimit(unsigned int _index, math::Angle _limit)` |
*Set lower joint limit* | 
`bool SetLowStop(unsigned int _index, const math::Angle &_angle)` | `virtual oid SetLowerLimit(const unsigned int _index, const double _limit)`
`void SetLowerLimit(unsigned int _index, math::Angle _limit)` |
*Get upper joint limit* |
`virtual math::Angle GetHighStop(unsigned int _index) = 0` | `virtual double UpperLimit(const unsigned int _index = 0) const`
`math::Angle GetUpperLimit(unsigned int _index) const` |
*Get lower joint limit* |
`virtual math::Angle GetLowStop(unsigned int _index) = 0` | `virtual double LowerLimit(const unsigned int _index = 0) const`
`math::Angle GetLowerLimit(unsigned int _index) const` |
*Lower joint limit, as determined by the base class* |
`math::Angle lowerLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]` | `double lowerLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]`
*Upper joint limit, as determined by the base class* |
`math::Angle upperLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]` | `double upperLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]`

The API changes in several ways:

* `math::Angle` -> `double` 

* No more returning `bool`

* "get"s are const

* All input params are const

* When "getting", the default index is zero

* All functions are virtual

* Only `PositionImpl` is pure virtual

# Commits

There are many changes, but they are mostly repeated. I recommend reviewing one commit at a time:

* 06b7dcc: GetAngleCount -> DOF

* e0294c0: upperLimit, lowerLimit and staticAngle to double

* 98ac226: Deprecate SetUpper/LowerLimit which take angle in favor of double

* 92d4573: Deprecate GetUpper/LowerLimit which return angle in favor of double

* 9ce869e: Deprecate GetAngle() in favor of Position()

* 03b7ba1: Deprecate GetAngleImpl() in favor of PositionImpl()

* 90fa193: Deprecate GetHigh/LowStop in favor of Upper/LowerLimit, also make it not pure virtual

* 202b5cd: Make Upper/LowerLimit const functions

* 67ba648: Deprecate SetHigh/LowStop in favor of SetUpper/LowerLimit

* d4b5dec: Make Set* virtual, remove using, fix switches and returns

Obs: If this is taking too long to review, I'll break this PR into smaller PRs, mostly following the commits above.
values.title: Deprecate angle API from physics::Joint, in favor of using doubles

summary.raw:
Fixes issue #553 and issue #1108

# API change summary

Old | New
--- | ---
*Get number of degrees of freedom* |
`virtual unsigned int GetAngleCount() const = 0` | `virtual unsigned int DOF() const = 0`
*Get joint position* |
`math::Angle GetAngle(unsigned int _index) const` | `virtual double Position(const unsigned int _index = 0) const final`
`virtual math::Angle GetAngleImpl(unsigned int _index) const = 0` | `virtual double PositionImpl(const unsigned int _index = 0) const = 0`
*Set upper joint limit* | 
`bool SetHighStop(unsigned int _index, const math::Angle &_angle)` | `virtual void SetUpperLimit(const unsigned int _index, const double _limit)`
`void SetUpperLimit(unsigned int _index, math::Angle _limit)` |
*Set lower joint limit* | 
`bool SetLowStop(unsigned int _index, const math::Angle &_angle)` | `virtual oid SetLowerLimit(const unsigned int _index, const double _limit)`
`void SetLowerLimit(unsigned int _index, math::Angle _limit)` |
*Get upper joint limit* |
`virtual math::Angle GetHighStop(unsigned int _index) = 0` | `virtual double UpperLimit(const unsigned int _index = 0) const`
`math::Angle GetUpperLimit(unsigned int _index) const` |
*Get lower joint limit* |
`virtual math::Angle GetLowStop(unsigned int _index) = 0` | `virtual double LowerLimit(const unsigned int _index = 0) const`
`math::Angle GetLowerLimit(unsigned int _index) const` |
*Lower joint limit, as determined by the base class* |
`math::Angle lowerLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]` | `double lowerLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]`
*Upper joint limit, as determined by the base class* |
`math::Angle upperLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]` | `double upperLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]`

The API changes in several ways:

* `math::Angle` -> `double` 

* No more returning `bool`

* "get"s are const

* All input params are const

* When "getting", the default index is zero

* All functions are virtual

* Only `PositionImpl` is pure virtual

# Commits

There are many changes, but they are mostly repeated. I recommend reviewing one commit at a time:

* 06b7dcc: GetAngleCount -> DOF

* e0294c0: upperLimit, lowerLimit and staticAngle to double

* 98ac226: Deprecate SetUpper/LowerLimit which take angle in favor of double

* 92d4573: Deprecate GetUpper/LowerLimit which return angle in favor of double

* 9ce869e: Deprecate GetAngle() in favor of Position()

* 03b7ba1: Deprecate GetAngleImpl() in favor of PositionImpl()

* 90fa193: Deprecate GetHigh/LowStop in favor of Upper/LowerLimit, also make it not pure virtual

* 202b5cd: Make Upper/LowerLimit const functions

* 67ba648: Deprecate SetHigh/LowStop in favor of SetUpper/LowerLimit

* d4b5dec: Make Set* virtual, remove using, fix switches and returns

Obs: If this is taking too long to review, I'll break this PR into smaller PRs, mostly following the commits above.
summary.html:
Fixes issue #553 and issue #1108

API change summary

Old New
Get number of degrees of freedom
virtual unsigned int GetAngleCount() const = 0 virtual unsigned int DOF() const = 0
Get joint position
math::Angle GetAngle(unsigned int _index) const virtual double Position(const unsigned int _index = 0) const final
virtual math::Angle GetAngleImpl(unsigned int _index) const = 0 virtual double PositionImpl(const unsigned int _index = 0) const = 0
Set upper joint limit
bool SetHighStop(unsigned int _index, const math::Angle &_angle) virtual void SetUpperLimit(const unsigned int _index, const double _limit)
void SetUpperLimit(unsigned int _index, math::Angle _limit)
Set lower joint limit
bool SetLowStop(unsigned int _index, const math::Angle &_angle) virtual oid SetLowerLimit(const unsigned int _index, const double _limit)
void SetLowerLimit(unsigned int _index, math::Angle _limit)
Get upper joint limit
virtual math::Angle GetHighStop(unsigned int _index) = 0 virtual double UpperLimit(const unsigned int _index = 0) const
math::Angle GetUpperLimit(unsigned int _index) const
Get lower joint limit
virtual math::Angle GetLowStop(unsigned int _index) = 0 virtual double LowerLimit(const unsigned int _index = 0) const
math::Angle GetLowerLimit(unsigned int _index) const
Lower joint limit, as determined by the base class
math::Angle lowerLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS] double lowerLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]
Upper joint limit, as determined by the base class
math::Angle upperLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS] double upperLimit[MAX_JOINT_AXIS]

The API changes in several ways:

  • math::Angle -> double

  • No more returning bool

  • "get"s are const

  • All input params are const

  • When "getting", the default index is zero

  • All functions are virtual

  • Only PositionImpl is pure virtual

Commits

There are many changes, but they are mostly repeated. I recommend reviewing one commit at a time:

  • 06b7dcc: GetAngleCount -> DOF

  • e0294c0: upperLimit, lowerLimit and staticAngle to double

  • 98ac226: Deprecate SetUpper/LowerLimit which take angle in favor of double

  • 92d4573: Deprecate GetUpper/LowerLimit which return angle in favor of double

  • 9ce869e: Deprecate GetAngle() in favor of Position()

  • 03b7ba1: Deprecate GetAngleImpl() in favor of PositionImpl()

  • 90fa193: Deprecate GetHigh/LowStop in favor of Upper/LowerLimit, also make it not pure virtual

  • 202b5cd: Make Upper/LowerLimit const functions

  • 67ba648: Deprecate SetHigh/LowStop in favor of SetUpper/LowerLimit

  • d4b5dec: Make Set* virtual, remove using, fix switches and returns

Obs: If this is taking too long to review, I'll break this PR into smaller PRs, mostly following the commits above.

values.description:
Upgrade to qt5. This is a revival of pull request #2353. 

New changes in addition to the ones in pull request #2353 are:

* fix qt5 + ogre on high dpi displays, i.e. apple retina displays. Requires this [ogre1.9 homebrew formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre1.9.rb)

* fix building examples and plugins

* Updated QTestFixture and ServerFixture to clean up rendering after each test

Known issues:

* deletion of the ogre 1.9 root object fails on OSX. Added a workaround to detach render window before destruction.

* This is a tear down issue with qt5 + ogre which cause some gui tests to fail. The tests pass when run individually but fail if run in sequence. I was able to work around some of them by rearranging the test order. 

* There's a weird problem with qt5 + ogre 1.9 on osx that causes gazebo to crash when launching a world with many ogre manual objects (e.g. simple shapes) and no lights in the scene. Could be related to [this forum post](http://www.ogre3d.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=78306). Using a separate box mesh for SelectionObj's and/or adding a light source seem to make things work but exact cause of the problem is still unknown.

Jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/868/) - The 3 plugin test failures should be fixed by updating jenkins homebrew release-tools to find Qt5 properly. 2 GUI test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.

[xenial](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test/31/) - 2 test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.


TODO:

* Make qwt a required dependency instead of optional
values.title: Qt5

summary.raw:
Upgrade to qt5. This is a revival of pull request #2353. 

New changes in addition to the ones in pull request #2353 are:

* fix qt5 + ogre on high dpi displays, i.e. apple retina displays. Requires this [ogre1.9 homebrew formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre1.9.rb)

* fix building examples and plugins

* Updated QTestFixture and ServerFixture to clean up rendering after each test

Known issues:

* deletion of the ogre 1.9 root object fails on OSX. Added a workaround to detach render window before destruction.

* This is a tear down issue with qt5 + ogre which cause some gui tests to fail. The tests pass when run individually but fail if run in sequence. I was able to work around some of them by rearranging the test order. 

* There's a weird problem with qt5 + ogre 1.9 on osx that causes gazebo to crash when launching a world with many ogre manual objects (e.g. simple shapes) and no lights in the scene. Could be related to [this forum post](http://www.ogre3d.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=78306). Using a separate box mesh for SelectionObj's and/or adding a light source seem to make things work but exact cause of the problem is still unknown.

Jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/868/) - The 3 plugin test failures should be fixed by updating jenkins homebrew release-tools to find Qt5 properly. 2 GUI test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.

[xenial](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test/31/) - 2 test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.

* Make qwt a required dependency instead of optional
summary.html:
Upgrade to qt5. This is a revival of pull request #2353.

New changes in addition to the ones in pull request #2353 are:

  • fix qt5 + ogre on high dpi displays, i.e. apple retina displays. Requires this ogre1.9 homebrew formula

  • fix building examples and plugins

  • Updated QTestFixture and ServerFixture to clean up rendering after each test

Known issues:

  • deletion of the ogre 1.9 root object fails on OSX. Added a workaround to detach render window before destruction.

  • This is a tear down issue with qt5 + ogre which cause some gui tests to fail. The tests pass when run individually but fail if run in sequence. I was able to work around some of them by rearranging the test order.

  • There's a weird problem with qt5 + ogre 1.9 on osx that causes gazebo to crash when launching a world with many ogre manual objects (e.g. simple shapes) and no lights in the scene. Could be related to this forum post. Using a separate box mesh for SelectionObj's and/or adding a light source seem to make things work but exact cause of the problem is still unknown.

Jenkins:

homebrew - The 3 plugin test failures should be fixed by updating jenkins homebrew release-tools to find Qt5 properly. 2 GUI test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.

xenial - 2 test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.

TODO:

  • Make qwt a required dependency instead of optional

values.description:
Most `gazebo::math` classes have been deprecated, we're only missing `Vector3`, `Quaternion`, `Pose` and macros.

When we deprecate them, even if they're not being used in the public-facing API, we will have to handle warnings of instances being used elsewhere. I see two solutions:

1. Ignore all deprecation warnings during the Gazebo 8 release. We can remove all non public math later and then re-enable deprecation warnings.

1. Convert all instances of gazebo math, even the ones which are not exposed in the API.

This pull request is a step for number 2.
values.title: Remove some gazebo::math left in gui, rendering, plugins and tests

summary.raw:
Most `gazebo::math` classes have been deprecated, we're only missing `Vector3`, `Quaternion`, `Pose` and macros.

When we deprecate them, even if they're not being used in the public-facing API, we will have to handle warnings of instances being used elsewhere. I see two solutions:

1. Ignore all deprecation warnings during the Gazebo 8 release. We can remove all non public math later and then re-enable deprecation warnings.

1. Convert all instances of gazebo math, even the ones which are not exposed in the API.

This pull request is a step for number 2.
summary.html:
Most gazebo::math classes have been deprecated, we're only missing Vector3, Quaternion, Pose and macros.

When we deprecate them, even if they're not being used in the public-facing API, we will have to handle warnings of instances being used elsewhere. I see two solutions:

  1. Ignore all deprecation warnings during the Gazebo 8 release. We can remove all non public math later and then re-enable deprecation warnings.

  2. Convert all instances of gazebo math, even the ones which are not exposed in the API.

This pull request is a step for number 2.

values.description:
This deprecates a bunch of macros and two static variables in gazebo/math/Helpers.hh. After this, everything in the file should be deprecated. They are replaced by static const values in ignition-math added in [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/137), which makes ignition-math 2.7 required.

* deprecate gazebo::math::NAN_* static variables

* Add deprecated static variables to match what will be added to ignition-math

* Replace GZ_DBL_INF with ignition::math::INF_D

* Replace GZ_DBL_MAX/MIN with ignition::math::MAX/MIN_D

* Replace GZ_FLt_MAX/MIN with ignition::math::MAX/MIN_F

* Replace GZ_U*INT32_MAX with ignition::math::MAX_U*I32

* changelog and migration guide

* require ignition-math 2.7
values.title: Deprecate math macros

summary.raw:
This deprecates a bunch of macros and two static variables in gazebo/math/Helpers.hh. After this, everything in the file should be deprecated. They are replaced by static const values in ignition-math added in [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/137), which makes ignition-math 2.7 required.

* deprecate gazebo::math::NAN_* static variables

* Add deprecated static variables to match what will be added to ignition-math

* Replace GZ_DBL_INF with ignition::math::INF_D

* Replace GZ_DBL_MAX/MIN with ignition::math::MAX/MIN_D

* Replace GZ_FLt_MAX/MIN with ignition::math::MAX/MIN_F

* Replace GZ_U*INT32_MAX with ignition::math::MAX_U*I32

* changelog and migration guide

* require ignition-math 2.7
summary.html:
This deprecates a bunch of macros and two static variables in gazebo/math/Helpers.hh. After this, everything in the file should be deprecated. They are replaced by static const values in ignition-math added in this pull request, which makes ignition-math 2.7 required.

  • deprecate gazebo::math::NAN_* static variables

  • Add deprecated static variables to match what will be added to ignition-math

  • Replace GZ_DBL_INF with ignition::math::INF_D

  • Replace GZ_DBL_MAX/MIN with ignition::math::MAX/MIN_D

  • Replace GZ_FLt_MAX/MIN with ignition::math::MAX/MIN_F

  • Replace GZ_UINT32_MAX with ignition::math::MAX_UI32

  • changelog and migration guide

  • require ignition-math 2.7

values.description:
Deprecated all the constructors, and also functions which return `Matrix3` and `Matrix4`. Also stopped using `Angle`.

Quaternion is widely used in `Pose`. If we don't get to deprecate pose, we won't be able to remove the quaternion class in Gazebo8. But at least we can remove the classes mentioned above. (And all others, all we miss now is `Pose` and `Vector3`)
values.title: Deprecate quaternion

summary.raw:
Deprecated all the constructors, and also functions which return `Matrix3` and `Matrix4`. Also stopped using `Angle`.

Quaternion is widely used in `Pose`. If we don't get to deprecate pose, we won't be able to remove the quaternion class in Gazebo8. But at least we can remove the classes mentioned above. (And all others, all we miss now is `Pose` and `Vector3`)
summary.html:
Deprecated all the constructors, and also functions which return Matrix3 and Matrix4. Also stopped using Angle.

Quaternion is widely used in Pose. If we don't get to deprecate pose, we won't be able to remove the quaternion class in Gazebo8. But at least we can remove the classes mentioned above. (And all others, all we miss now is Pose and Vector3)

values.description:
issue #2123

Revert scene time changes done in the markers [pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2541/markers-take-2/diff). The `Scene::SimTime()` function was always returning the largest time and so fails to ack time reset. In addition, the sim time received via the `world_stats` topic does not always correspond to the time the scene is actually updated. I believe the rendering sensor timestamps may be broken by the these changes.

I reverted the changes and made sure markers still work on world reset.
values.title: Fix CameraSensor WorldReset integration test

issue #2123

Revert scene time changes done in the markers [pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2541/markers-take-2/diff). The `Scene::SimTime()` function was always returning the largest time and so fails to ack time reset. In addition, the sim time received via the `world_stats` topic does not always correspond to the time the scene is actually updated. I believe the rendering sensor timestamps may be broken by the these changes.

I reverted the changes and made sure markers still work on world reset.
summary.html:
issue #2123

Revert scene time changes done in the markers pull request. The Scene::SimTime() function was always returning the largest time and so fails to ack time reset. In addition, the sim time received via the world_stats topic does not always correspond to the time the scene is actually updated. I believe the rendering sensor timestamps may be broken by the these changes.

I reverted the changes and made sure markers still work on world reset.

values.title: Remove gazebo8 deprecations and all gazebo::math
values.reason: This pull request was here mostly to track the process of deprecating gazebo math. It's now being broken down into smaller PRs so it's easier to review.

values.description:
I'm pretty confident that this pull request removes all instances of gazebo math from outside deprecated functions.

I checked by:

1. merging this branch into [remove_gazebo8_deprecations](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2592/remove-gazebo8-deprecations/diff)

1. removed the deprecations added in this pull request

1. removed the gazebo math directory and all references to it

1. and everything compiles :heavy_exclamation_mark:

After this pull request is merged, we will need one to deprecate `Vector3` and `Pose` (pull request #2595) like pull request #2583 did for `Quaternions`.

And that's the end of gazebo math :smile:
values.title: Use ignition::math, the leftover of the leftover

After this pull request is merged, we will need one to deprecate `Vector3` and `Pose` (pull request #2595) like pull request #2583 did for `Quaternions`.

summary.html:
I'm pretty confident that this pull request removes all instances of gazebo math from outside deprecated functions.

I checked by:

  1. merging this branch into remove_gazebo8_deprecations

  2. removed the deprecations added in this pull request

  3. removed the gazebo math directory and all references to it

  4. and everything compiles :heavy_exclamation_mark:

After this pull request is merged, we will need one to deprecate Vector3 and Pose (pull request #2595) like pull request #2583 did for Quaternions.

And that's the end of gazebo math

values.description:
This pull request builds on top of pull request #2594, review and merge that one first.

It's the final step of deprecating gazebo math.

I didn't finish ignoring all the warnings. @nkoenig mentioned that it would be ok to leave gazebo8 with deprecation warnings for now and fix that during feature freeze.
values.title: Deprecate Vector3 and Pose (bye bye gzmath)

values.description:
Fixes the following Qt5 mouse scroll wheel issues:

* Fast scrolling sometimes causes camera to zoom in reversed direction [QTBUG-46461](https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-46461). 

    occurs when there are too many wheel events so implemented workaround to handle wheelevents at an update rate <= GLWidget update rate

* Occasional reversed zoom direction on OSX 

    updated code to handle the case when wheel event `delta` has a value of `0`

* Incorrect zoom in the plotting utility (mentioned in issue #1804). 

    removed check for plot axis scale map transformation value which always seems to be `NULL` in qwt-qt5
values.title: Fix mouse scroll wheel zooming

summary.raw:
Fixes the following Qt5 mouse scroll wheel issues:

* Fast scrolling sometimes causes camera to zoom in reversed direction [QTBUG-46461](https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-46461). 

    occurs when there are too many wheel events so implemented workaround to handle wheelevents at an update rate <= GLWidget update rate

* Occasional reversed zoom direction on OSX 

    updated code to handle the case when wheel event `delta` has a value of `0`

* Incorrect zoom in the plotting utility (mentioned in issue #1804). 

    removed check for plot axis scale map transformation value which always seems to be `NULL` in qwt-qt5
summary.html:
Fixes the following Qt5 mouse scroll wheel issues:

  • Fast scrolling sometimes causes camera to zoom in reversed direction QTBUG-46461.

    occurs when there are too many wheel events so implemented workaround to handle wheelevents at an update rate <= GLWidget update rate

  • Occasional reversed zoom direction on OSX

    updated code to handle the case when wheel event delta has a value of 0

  • Incorrect zoom in the plotting utility (mentioned in issue #1804).

    removed check for plot axis scale map transformation value which always seems to be NULL in qwt-qt5

values.description:
issue #2130

now that mesh material transparency values are actually being used after pull request #2536, it exposed a problem reading the collada texture transparency value. Looking at the collada spec [pdf](https://www.khronos.org/files/collada_spec_1_5.pdf), the final transparency value is calculated based on two attributes: `<transparent>` and `<transparency>` but we were only using the latter value. 

The blend factor src and dst factor values also seem to be reversed as per [ogre Pass documentation](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/manual/manual_16.html#scene_005fblend). It doesn't look like they are being used at the moment when creating the visual but I reversed them anyway to be consistent with the intended usage.
values.title: Fix collada loader transparency

summary.raw:
issue #2130

now that mesh material transparency values are actually being used after pull request #2536, it exposed a problem reading the collada texture transparency value. Looking at the collada spec [pdf](https://www.khronos.org/files/collada_spec_1_5.pdf), the final transparency value is calculated based on two attributes: `<transparent>` and `<transparency>` but we were only using the latter value. 

The blend factor src and dst factor values also seem to be reversed as per [ogre Pass documentation](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/manual/manual_16.html#scene_005fblend). It doesn't look like they are being used at the moment when creating the visual but I reversed them anyway to be consistent with the intended usage.
summary.html:
issue #2130

now that mesh material transparency values are actually being used after pull request #2536, it exposed a problem reading the collada texture transparency value. Looking at the collada spec pdf, the final transparency value is calculated based on two attributes: <transparent> and <transparency> but we were only using the latter value.

The blend factor src and dst factor values also seem to be reversed as per ogre Pass documentation. It doesn't look like they are being used at the moment when creating the visual but I reversed them anyway to be consistent with the intended usage.
